Key Match Events: Jeremy Gordon and Dillon Heyliger took wickets as Ireland restricted to 125-7
Pre-Game Insights: Canada, who are the lowest-ranked side in the tournament, won against Ireland
Ireland's lack of adaptability to different conditions, both with bat and ball, has cost them here.
Canada outplayed Ireland in all three disciplines: bat, ball, and field.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's win is their first win in the World Cup and a historic day at the T20 World Cup
Canada's next focus is on Pakistan
Andrew Leonard commented that Ireland has been out-skilled and outplayed in all three disciplines.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in New York
Adair was caught by Gordon for 34 (Ire 121-7)
